answers.answer: Listen, you need to see an ophthalmologist right away.  At the least you have significant swelling and inflammation of the cornea and may also have a dangerous corneal ulcer.  You need to be seen right away in order to avoid possible serious permanant damage to the eye.  Good Luck, with proper treatment, you should do fine.Michael Kutryb, MD

question: I woke up in the middle of the night with stinging pain in my right eye, along with redness, tearing, ghost image, and fogginess. I wear contacts and had felt some mild irritation and some redness in both my eyes, and I figured my lenses were getting old and I needed to start wearing a fresh pair. I do not sleep with my lenses in, I did fall asleep for approximately 1/2 hr with them in. When I woke up with these symptoms, I rinsed my eye with saline solution, and applied a cold compress. The tearing and stinging stopped, but the rest of the symptoms still persist. Did I unknowingly injure my eye? I was recently diagnosed with being in the early stages of Diabetes Type II, is this a factor?
title: Ghost image and foggy vision
